scores.summary: Currently, most teachers in reservation schools are non-Indian, the turnover rates are extremely high, and many believe the teachers do not understand Indian culture and learning styles. As crime rates fall nationwide, they are rising in American Indian communities, especially among the 43 percent of Indians under age 20. Federal lawmakers also soon must sort out the muddled state of American Indian gambling, which has pitted tribes desperate for casino revenue against state governments resistant to gambling.

Currently, most teachers in reservation schools are non-Indian, the turnover rates are extremely high, and many believe the teachers do not understand Indian culture and learning styles. As crime rates fall nationwide, they are rising in American Indian communities, especially among the 43 percent of Indians under age 20. Federal lawmakers also soon must sort out the muddled state of American Indian gambling, which has pitted tribes desperate for casino revenue against state governments resistant to gambling. Indian tribes are in court fighting for the right to establish multistate bingo, lottery and casino games that offer big jackpots. A visit to the San Manuel Indian Bingo and Casino on a patch of tribal land 60 miles east of Los Angeles makes the stakes clear.

Metropolitan Police Commissioner Sir Paul Condon told Stephen Lawrence's parents that he accepts the ``anger and frustration'' directed at him. An official report last year condemned the capital's police force for institutional racism. Macpherson's report is a scathing indictment of not only the police but all those in Britain who have ignored or tolerated racism. Racial biases even prevented police officers at the scene from providing first aid to Lawrence who lay bleeding to death on the sidewalk, the report said. Minorities make up more than 5 percent of the population in all of Britain, but less than 2 percent of all police officers. Straw has already announced that officers will soon be liable to criminal prosecution for discrimination when police forces are brought under the Race Relations Act. Straw told the parliament that he had ordered an immediate inspection of the London Metropolitan police force by the Inspectorate of Constabulary. The chief of Britain's largest police force apologized Thursday to the parents of a black teenager whose stabbing death five years ago focused attention on relations between police and minorities. Residents of about 22 percent of the state's rental housing stock receive some form of state or federal subsidy. In the past, the Housing Authority's mission had mainly been to produce and maintain low-income rental housing with the help of government subsides. Position: To be public housing tenants. Lazio's measure establishes block grants to states for federal housing assistance, requires public housing tenants to perform community service and integrates those communities with economically mixed residents. The Clinton administration has sought to increase the supply of affordable housing units, requesting 103,000 new rental assistance vouchers in the 1999 budget. Some property owners are dropping out of federal affordable housing subsidy programs in which low-income people pay about 30 percent of their income as rent. Federal Housing Secretary Andrew Cuomo said the report by the National Low Income Housing Coalition, which favors raising the minimum wage, demonstrates the flip side of the booming economy. Another provision would authorize money for nonprofit organizations seeking to purchase, improve and preserve affordable federally assisted and federally insured housing for the benefit of low-income tenants.

Though both of those measures would make relatively small increases in public housing resources, Cuomo contends they are important because the Republican-controlled Congress has perennially talked of cutting housing programs. The bill, which increases funding for housing programs by $71 million, seeks to modernize the program and provide incentives to building owners to stay in the program. The boost, which takes effect next month, is part of a $100 million-a-year plan to increase the share of rental housing available for federal subsidies from 40 percent to 50 percent. It would amount to the largest expansion of the housing program in a decade. The six-year old Cuban boy Elian Gonzalez returned to his native land in Cuba by a chartered plane Wednesday with his father and other relatives, ending a seven- month long bitter custody battle. The development came as negotiations between federal immigration officials and Elian's Miami relatives remained at an impasse. A spokeswoman of the Vietnamese Foreign Ministry Monday demands that the United States immediately return Cuban Boy Elian Gonzales so that he can reunite with his father.

The six-year old Cuban boy Elian Gonzalez returned to his native land in Cuba by a chartered plane Wednesday with his father and other relatives, ending a seven- month long bitter custody battle. The development came as negotiations between federal immigration officials and Elian's Miami relatives remained at an impasse. A spokeswoman of the Vietnamese Foreign Ministry Monday demands that the United States immediately return Cuban Boy Elian Gonzales so that he can reunite with his father. The Supreme Court on Wednesday refused to issue an order to keep Elian Gonzalez in the United States, clearing the way for the 6-year-old boy to return home to Cuba. The officials had said that Elian would be accompanied by Lazaro Gonzalez and Lazaro's 21-year-old daughter, Marisleysis Gonzalez.

Father and son were reunited on April 22 after Elian was taken forcibly from the Miami relatives' home during an armed federal raid.
